cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW today just south of Cuba, then turning NW Tuesday night and Wednesday toward the north-west Gulf; aims for the Texas–Louisiana border coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border (Cameron-Lake Charles vicinity)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches yet for the U.S. Gulf Coast (current watches confined to Cuba/Florida Keys)
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings yet for the U.S. Gulf Coast (current warnings confined to Cuba/Florida Keys)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central and north-western Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana, especially the TX/LA border region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) increasingly likely; hurricane-force gusts possible if Laura reaches Category 1/2 at landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential significant surge exceeding 3 ft and possibly 6–9 ft along southwest Louisiana coast including Calcasieu Pass/Lake Charles if the storm strengthens to hurricane intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast totals 5–10 inches with isolated peaks to 15 inches near and east of the track; flash flooding and urban flooding likely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands, hazardous seas, and prolonged channel/river high water affecting port approaches.
